suite2p.register¶

Module Contents¶

suite2p.register.eps0 = 1e-05[source]¶
suite2p.register.sigL = 0.85[source]¶
suite2p.register.hp = 60[source]¶
suite2p.register.gaussian_fft(sig, Ly, Lx)[source]¶

gaussian filter in the fft domain with std sig and size Ly,Lx

suite2p.register.spatial_taper(sig, Ly, Lx)[source]¶

spatial taper on edges with gaussian of std sig

suite2p.register.spatial_smooth(data, N)[source]¶

spatially smooth data using cumsum over axis=1,2 with window N

suite2p.register.spatial_high_pass(data, N)[source]¶

high pass filters data over axis=1,2 with window N

suite2p.register.one_photon_preprocess(data, ops)[source]¶

pre filtering for one-photon data

suite2p.register.prepare_masks(refImg0, ops)[source]¶

computes masks and fft’ed reference image for phasecorr

Parameters

  • refImg0 (int16) – reference image

  • ops (dictionary) – requires ‘smooth_sigma’ (if `ops['1Preg']`, need ‘spatial_taper’, ‘spatial_hp’, ‘pre_smooth’)

Returns

  • maskMul (float32) – mask that is multiplied to spatially taper frames

  • maskOffset (float32) – shifts in x from cfRefImg to data for each frame

  • cfRefImg (complex64) – reference image fft’ed and complex conjugate and multiplied by gaussian filter in the fft domain with standard deviation ‘smooth_sigma’

suite2p.register.shift_data(X, ymax, xmax)[source]¶

rigid shift X by integer shifts ymax and xmax in place (no return)

Parameters

  • X (int16) – array that’s frames x Ly x Lx

  • ymax (int) – shifts in y from cfRefImg to data for each frame

  • xmax (int) – shifts in x from cfRefImg to data for each frame

suite2p.register.addmultiplytype(x, y, z)[source]¶
suite2p.register.apply_dotnorm(Y, cfRefImg)[source]¶
suite2p.register.phasecorr(data, refAndMasks, ops)[source]¶

compute registration offsets

suite2p.register.my_clip(X, lcorr)[source]¶

perform 2D fftshift and crop with lcorr

suite2p.register.phasecorr_cpu(data, refAndMasks, lcorr)[source]¶

compute phase correlation between data and reference image

Parameters

  • data (int16) – array that’s frames x Ly x Lx

  • refAndMasks (list) – maskMul, maskOffset and cfRefImg (from prepare_refAndMasks)

  • lcorr (int) – maximum shift in pixels

Returns

  • ymax (int) – shifts in y from cfRefImg to data for each frame

  • xmax (int) – shifts in x from cfRefImg to data for each frame

  • cmax (float) – maximum of phase correlation for each frame

suite2p.register.register_and_shift(data, refAndMasks, ops)[source]¶

register data matrix to reference image and shift

need to run `refAndMasks = register.prepare_refAndMasks(ops)` to get fft’ed masks; if `ops['nonrigid']` need to run `ops = utils.make_blocks(ops)`

Parameters

  • data (int16) – array that’s frames x Ly x Lx

  • refAndMasks (list) – maskMul, maskOffset and cfRefImg (from prepare_refAndMasks)

  • ops (dictionary) – requires ‘nonrigid’, ‘bidiphase’, ‘1Preg’

Returns

  • data (int16) – registered frames x Ly x Lx

  • ymax (int) – shifts in y from cfRefImg to data for each frame

  • xmax (int) – shifts in x from cfRefImg to data for each frame

  • cmax (float) – maximum of phase correlation for each frame

  • yxnr (list) – ymax, xmax and cmax from the non-rigid registration

suite2p.register.get_nFrames(ops)[source]¶

get number of frames in binary file

Parameters

ops (dictionary) – requires ‘Ly’, ‘Lx’, ‘reg_file’ (optional ‘keep_movie_raw’ and ‘raw_file’)

Returns

nFrames – number of frames in the binary

Return type

int

suite2p.register.subsample_frames(ops, nsamps)[source]¶

get nsamps frames from binary file for initial reference image

Parameters

  • ops (dictionary) – requires ‘Ly’, ‘Lx’, ‘nframes’, ‘reg_file’ (optional ‘keep_movie_raw’ and ‘raw_file’)

  • nsamps (int) – number of frames to return

Returns

frames – frames x Ly x Lx

Return type

int16

suite2p.register.get_bidiphase(frames)[source]¶

computes the bidirectional phase offset

sometimes in line scanning there will be offsets between lines; if ops[‘do_bidiphase’], then bidiphase is computed and applied

Parameters

frames (int16) – random subsample of frames in binary (frames x Ly x Lx)

Returns

bidiphase – bidirectional phase offset in pixels

Return type

int

suite2p.register.shift_bidiphase(frames, bidiphase)[source]¶

shift frames by bidirectional phase offset, bidiphase

sometimes in line scanning there will be offsets between lines; shifts last axis by bidiphase

Parameters

  • frames (int16) – frames from binary (frames x Ly x Lx)

  • bidiphase (int) – bidirectional phase offset in pixels

Returns

frames – shifted frames from binary (frames x Ly x Lx)

Return type

int16

suite2p.register.pick_initial_reference(frames)[source]¶

computes the initial reference image

the seed frame is the frame with the largest correlations with other frames; the average of the seed frame with its top 20 correlated pairs is the inital reference frame returned

Parameters

frames (int16) – frames from binary (frames x Ly x Lx)

Returns

refImg – initial reference image (Ly x Lx)

Return type

int16

suite2p.register.iterative_alignment(ops, frames, refImg)[source]¶

iterative alignment of initial frames to compute reference image

the seed frame is the frame with the largest correlations with other frames; the average of the seed frame with its top 20 correlated pairs is the inital reference frame returned

Parameters

  • ops (dictionary) – requires ‘nonrigid’, ‘smooth_sigma’, ‘bidiphase’, ‘1Preg’

  • frames (int16) – frames from binary (frames x Ly x Lx)

  • refImg (int16) – initial reference image (Ly x Lx)

Returns

refImg – final reference image (Ly x Lx)

Return type

int16

suite2p.register.compute_reference_image(ops)[source]¶

compute the reference image

computes initial reference image using ops[‘nimg_init’] frames

Parameters

ops (dictionary) – requires ‘nimg_init’, ‘nonrigid’, ‘smooth_sigma’, ‘bidiphase’, ‘1Preg’, ‘reg_file’, (optional ‘keep_movie_raw’, ‘raw_movie’)

Returns

refImg – initial reference image (Ly x Lx)

Return type

int16

suite2p.register.prepare_refAndMasks(refImg, ops)[source]¶

prepares refAndMasks for phasecorr using refImg

Parameters

  • refImg (int16) – reference image

  • ops (dictionary) – requires ‘smooth_sigma’ (if `ops['1Preg']`, need ‘spatial_taper’, ‘spatial_hp’, ‘pre_smooth’)

Returns

refAndMasks – maskMul, maskOffset, cfRefImg (see register.prepare_masks for details)

Return type

list

suite2p.register.init_offsets(ops)[source]¶

initialize offsets for all frames

suite2p.register.compute_crop(ops)[source]¶

determines ops[‘badframes’] (using ops[‘th_badframes’]) and excludes these ops[‘badframes’] when computing valid ranges from registration in y and x

suite2p.register.write_tiffs(data, ops, k, ichan)[source]¶

writes frames to tiffs

Parameters

  • data (int16) – frames x Ly x Lx

  • ops (dictionary) – requires ‘functional_chan’, ‘align_by_chan’

  • k (int) – number of tiff

suite2p.register.bin_paths(ops, raw)[source]¶

set which binary is being aligned to

suite2p.register.register_binary_to_ref(ops, refImg, reg_file_align, raw_file_align)[source]¶

register binary data to reference image refImg

Parameters

  • ops (dictionary) –

  • refImg (int16) – reference image

  • reg_file_align (string) – file to (read if raw_file_align empty, and) write registered binary to

  • raw_file_align (string) – file to read raw binary from (if not empty)

Returns

  • ops (dictionary) – sets ‘meanImg’ or ‘meanImg_chan2’ maskMul, maskOffset, cfRefImg (see register.prepare_masks for details)

  • offsets (list) – [ymax, xmax, cmax, yxnr] <- shifts and correlations

suite2p.register.apply_shifts(data, ops, ymax, xmax, ymax1, xmax1)[source]¶

apply rigid and nonrigid shifts to data (for chan that’s not ‘align_by_chan’)

Parameters

data (int16) –

ops : dictionary

refImgint16

reference image

reg_file_alignstring

file to (read if raw_file_align empty, and) write registered binary to

raw_file_alignstring

file to read raw binary from (if not empty)

Returns

  • ops (dictionary) – sets ‘meanImg’ or ‘meanImg_chan2’ maskMul, maskOffset, cfRefImg (see register.prepare_masks for details)

  • offsets (list) – [ymax, xmax, cmax, yxnr] <- shifts and correlations

suite2p.register.apply_shifts_to_binary(ops, offsets, reg_file_alt, raw_file_alt)[source]¶

apply registration shifts to binary data

registration of binary files
